alert.note: Alert for Cass; Ransom (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 6:50AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Maple River near Enderlin affecting Ransom and Cass Counties. .Snowmelt is moving into the Maple River in Enderlin ND. Flood stage is expected to be reached after March 21st. For the Maple River...including Enderlin, Mapleton (South of I-94)... Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River near Enderlin. * WHEN...From Monday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding of some farm buildings begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 5.7 feet and then begin rising this morning. It will then rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to 10.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will fall to 10.4 feet and then begin rising early Friday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
